result.execSummary:
The defendant Chaz Landon Holifield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chaz Landon Holifield is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chaz Landon Holifield was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: E-mail from Angela Turner to Judge Flanagan

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel, Alicia B., and defendant as to sentencing.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9   MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 2 (two) days served.

- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments (this includes victim/witness, domestic violence and DNA surcharge).  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.
- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Due to a change in the defendant's financial situation, defendant ordered to the Public Defender's Office to determine eligibility.  Defendant returns from Public Defender's Office. Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney James E Toran.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney James E Toran.  Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 1.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
